edu.cpp.cs.cs141.class_project

Class GamePlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.class_project.GamePlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener

    public class GamePlayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.io.Serializable
    CS 141: Introduction to Programming and Problem Solving Professor: Edwin Rodríguez Programming Assignment: Class Project In this assignment, our team created a two dimensional grid game. The grid is 9 by 9 with 9 rooms equally distributed throughout the grid with one of them having the briefcase. That briefcase is the goal that the spy (the player) is trying to capture. The player must traverse through the grid while avoiding enemies. The player can only see two spaces in front of him and cannot tell if the room has the briefcase without checking the room. The player is also aided by power-ups. Once the player finds the briefcase they win. However, if they die three times, they lose. Team: Static Shock -Alexander Kimea -George Tong -Joshua Tellez -Ray Zuniga -Valerie Orozco
    See Also:

      A window that contains all the components of the GUI

      The object that is responsible for saving and loading.
      private java.awt.GridBagConstraints gbc
      An object that control the spacing of the components within the panel This control the spacing of the JLabels with the images
      private javax.swing.ButtonGroup group
      The group that contains the two radio buttons for easy mode and hard mode This makes it so that only one of the two buttons can be pressed at a time.
      private javax.swing.JMenuBar menuBar
      The menu that contains many options for player to perform numerous tasks The 3 options are: File, Options, and Mode
      private javax.swing.JMenu mnFile
      A File category that exists within the menu.

      A category that exists within the menu.
      private javax.swing.JMenu mnOptions
      An options category that exists within the menu.
      private javax.swing.JMenuItem mntmExit
      An exit option that exists in the menu under File This option will cause the whole entire JFrame to close.
      private javax.swing.JMenuItem mntmLoad
      A load option that exists in the menu under File This option allows the player to load a gameEngine by specifying which file to load.
      private javax.swing.JMenuItem mntmSave
      A save option that exists in the menu under File This option allows the player to save the gameEngine and give a custom name to their save file
      private javax.swing.JPanel panel
      A panel that is used for organizing the 2d array.
      private javax.swing.JRadioButtonMenuItem rdbtnmntmDebugMode
      An option to change the game to debug mode In debug mode, the player can see all of the objects within the grid.
      private javax.swing.JRadioButtonMenuItem rdbtnmntmEasyMode
      A option to change the game's mode to easy mode.
      private javax.swing.JRadioButtonMenuItem rdbtnmntmHardMode
      An option to change the game's mode to hard mode.
      private javax.swing.JRadioButtonMenuItem rdbtnmntmNormalMode
      An option to change the game to normal mode In normal mode, the player can only see two space in the direction that they are looking.
      private java.awt.GridBagConstraints textGBC
      An object that control the spacing of the components within the panel This controls the spacing of the JLabels with text.

      void checkDebugObject(int row, int col)
      A method that checks the grid and determines which JLabel to use for the corresponding object Each JLabel has a different picture depending on the object After choosing the picture, this method will add that JLabel to the JPanel with a GridBagLayout

      This method checks to see if the object should be given a graphical representation or a black square This method will only acknowledge the player and the two tiles that are in the direction the player is looking.

      void keyTyped(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e) 
      void moveAction()
      This method checks around the players for enemies and kills the player if there are enemies If there are no enemies then this method will check if you are invincible or not and will decrease invincibility if you are Finally this method will cause the enemies to move

      void setUp()
      Method used to add all the visual components to the Frame In addition all of the action listeners are created in this method Also the minimum amount of spacing between JLabels is initialized in this method This method also sets up the grid that is in the gameEngine

      This method will check if you are invincible and will decrease invincibility if you are.

      A method that will show the location of the briefcase/exit if you have the radar power-up Before the player acquires the radar, this will tell the player that the exit is unknown
      void showBullets()
      Creates a JLabel that states how many bullets you have left This Label is placed at row 6 and has a spacing of 50 pixels to the left and right

      Creates a JLabel that show how many turns the player is invincible for The maximum amount if 5 and at 0 the player is no longer invincible.
      void showLives()
      Creates a JLabel that shows how many lives the player has left.

      • game

        private Data game
        The object that is responsible for saving and loading. This also the GamePlayer to also be able to use save and load

      • frame

        private javax.swing.JFrame frame
        A window that contains all the components of the GUI

      • panel

        private javax.swing.JPanel panel
        A panel that is used for organizing the 2d array. The layout that will be used with this panel is gridbaglayout

      • gbc

        private java.awt.GridBagConstraints gbc
        An object that control the spacing of the components within the panel This control the spacing of the JLabels with the images

      • textGBC

        private java.awt.GridBagConstraints textGBC
        An object that control the spacing of the components within the panel This controls the spacing of the JLabels with text.

      • menuBar

        private javax.swing.JMenuBar menuBar
        The menu that contains many options for player to perform numerous tasks The 3 options are: File, Options, and Mode

      • mntmExit

        private javax.swing.JMenuItem mntmExit
        An exit option that exists in the menu under File This option will cause the whole entire JFrame to close.

      • mntmSave

        private javax.swing.JMenuItem mntmSave
        A save option that exists in the menu under File This option allows the player to save the gameEngine and give a custom name to their save file

      • mntmLoad

        private javax.swing.JMenuItem mntmLoad
        A load option that exists in the menu under File This option allows the player to load a gameEngine by specifying which file to load.

      • mnFile

        private javax.swing.JMenu mnFile
        A File category that exists within the menu. The file category contains options for saving, loading, and exiting.

      • mnOptions

        private javax.swing.JMenu mnOptions
        An options category that exists within the menu. The option category contains the two difficulties: Easy mode and Hard Mode

      • rdbtnmntmEasyMode

        private javax.swing.JRadioButtonMenuItem rdbtnmntmEasyMode
        A option to change the game's mode to easy mode. In easy mode the enemy's movements are completely random. Since this is a radio button, this cannot be selected at the same time as hard mode

      • rdbtnmntmHardMode

        private javax.swing.JRadioButtonMenuItem rdbtnmntmHardMode
        An option to change the game's mode to hard mode. In hard mode, the enemy has advanced AI and are capable of following the player Since this is a radio button, this cannot be selected at the same time as easy mode.

      • group

        private javax.swing.ButtonGroup group
        The group that contains the two radio buttons for easy mode and hard mode This makes it so that only one of the two buttons can be pressed at a time.

      • debugGroup

        private javax.swing.ButtonGroup debugGroup
        The group that contains the two radio buttons for normal mode and debug mode This makes is so that only one of the two buttons can be presssed at a time.

      • direction

        private int direction
        This is the direction that the player is facing. 1) up 2) down 3) left 4) right

      • mnMode

        private javax.swing.JMenu mnMode
        A category that exists within the menu. This category contains the options: Normal Mode and Debug Mode

      • rdbtnmntmNormalMode

        private javax.swing.JRadioButtonMenuItem rdbtnmntmNormalMode
        An option to change the game to normal mode In normal mode, the player can only see two space in the direction that they are looking. Since this is a radio button, this cannot be selected at the same time as debug mode

      • rdbtnmntmDebugMode

        private javax.swing.JRadioButtonMenuItem rdbtnmntmDebugMode
        An option to change the game to debug mode In debug mode, the player can see all of the objects within the grid. Since this is a radio button, this cannot be selected at the same time as normal mode

    • Constructor Detail

      • GamePlayer

        public GamePlayer()
        The default constructor for the GamePlayer class In this constructor all of the objects are initialized. The JFrame is also set to a resolution of 1110 by 768 pixels

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
        Method used to add all the visual components to the Frame In addition all of the action listeners are created in this method Also the minimum amount of spacing between JLabels is initialized in this method This method also sets up the grid that is in the gameEngine

      • showDirections

        public void showDirections()
        Creates a JLabel with instructions on how to play the game This creates 3 JLabels with: instructions on how to shoot, instructions on how to move, and instructions on how to look

      • showInvincibility

        public void showInvincibility()
        Creates a JLabel that show how many turns the player is invincible for The maximum amount if 5 and at 0 the player is no longer invincible. This will update with every step as well.

      • showBullets

        public void showBullets()
        Creates a JLabel that states how many bullets you have left This Label is placed at row 6 and has a spacing of 50 pixels to the left and right

      • showLives

        public void showLives()
        Creates a JLabel that shows how many lives the player has left. This will update every time a player loses a life. The game will end when you are out of lives.

      • showBrief

        public void showBrief()
        A method that will show the location of the briefcase/exit if you have the radar power-up Before the player acquires the radar, this will tell the player that the exit is unknown

      • getData

        public Data getData()
        A getter method for the gameEngine in the GamePlayer This method allows other classes to get access to the gameEngine.
        Returns:
        The game engine

      • createGrid

        public void createGrid()
                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method creates the graphical representation of the 2d array. The amount of viewable objects printed in the grid will vary depending on the mode.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Throws an error when the pictures for the objects are not found.

      • createNormalGrid

        public void createNormalGrid()
        Creates a 2d graphical array. Almost everything in this grid will be black except for the player and two tiles that the player can see.

      • checkNormalObject

        public void checkNormalObject(int row,
                              int col)
        This method checks to see if the object should be given a graphical representation or a black square This method will only acknowledge the player and the two tiles that are in the direction the player is looking. All other tiles will be pitch black since the player cannot see that far.
        Parameters:
        row - the current row that is being checked
        col - the current column that is being checked

      • createDebugGrid

        public void createDebugGrid()
        A method that creates a visual representation of all the objects within the grid using a JFrame and multiple JLabels
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the image doesn't exist, this exception will be thrown

      • replaceComponent

        public void replaceComponent(int row,
                             int col,
                             javax.swing.JLabel label)
        A method that access the Component at [row][col] and removes that component Afterwards a new JLabel is placed at that location
        Parameters:
        row - The row which you wish to access
        col - The column which you wish to access
        label - The JLabel you want to replace the current component with

      • checkDebugObject

        public void checkDebugObject(int row,
                             int col)
        A method that checks the grid and determines which JLabel to use for the corresponding object Each JLabel has a different picture depending on the object After choosing the picture, this method will add that JLabel to the JPanel with a GridBagLayout
        Parameters:
        row - The row which you wish to access
        col - The column which you wish to access

      • resetFrame

        public void resetFrame()
        A method that removes all components from the panel. After that, this method recreates the graphical 2d array in order to show any changes.

      • moveAction

        public void moveAction()
        This method checks around the players for enemies and kills the player if there are enemies If there are no enemies then this method will check if you are invincible or not and will decrease invincibility if you are Finally this method will cause the enemies to move

      • shootAction

        public void shootAction()
        This method will check if you are invincible and will decrease invincibility if you are. Afterwards all enemies will move.
